text.section:
To secure any bond issued under this subtitle, an authority may enter into a trust agreement with a corporate trustee, which may be:
A trust company; or
A bank that has the powers of a trust company.

Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, an authority may provide for:
Payment of the proceeds of the sale of its bonds and payment of any revenue of the authority to any officer, board, or depositary that the authority designates as custodian of the proceeds and revenues; and
Disbursement of the proceeds and revenues with any safeguards and restrictions that the authority determines.
An authority may treat any expense that is incurred in carrying out the provisions of a resolution or trust agreement under this section as a part of the cost of operation of the project.
